body:
$SPY $AAPL $NVDA $AMD $SOXL 
Apple Inc’s prime supplier Foxconn Technology Group halted operations at two of its factories in eastern China’s Kunshan after new COVID-19 cases were reported on site, the South China Morning Post reported on Monday.

The operations at those plants have been suspended since Wednesday last week, with all employees confined to dormitories inside, the report said.
The two Foxconn plants, located at Dianfa and Fuhong in the northern part of Kunshan, are two of four manufacturing campuses operated in the city by the Taiwanese firm, which is also known as Hon Hai Precision Industry Co Ltd.
https://www.aljazeera.com/economy/2022/4/25/apple-supplier-foxconn-suspends-production-at-two-china-factories

$LCID  interesting rumor circulating around Asian mkts over the weekend. And it actually makes a lot of sense. Because of $AAPL problems with project titan and Because of $LCID low stock price and very limited amount - less that 33% - of tradable stock, that $AAPL is considering a tender offer for  $LCID in order to gain access to its motor miniaturization tech, drivetrain tech, & great tech staff.  Will take private and co-venture with SA PIF as partner to develop the EV of everyone’s dreams.  Then IPO again down the road to cash out.  Actually makes a huge amount of sense. Entry price is super cheap because PIF has 64% ownership and easy to happen because it has voting control of the Board.

$AAPL option prices will be volatile so keep your head up. I remember one earnings the stock went up 5% and my call plummeted the following day at the open. Other times I bought an option at a decent price and still profited when the stock went in the wrong direction. When you’re playing options on earnings week, it’s all max greed. There’s no rhyme or reason to it! Best wishes! ✌🏻
